newsitem.title: UK: S&P raises Banco Santander - Chile ratings.
newsitem.headline: S&P raises Banco Santander - Chile ratings.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said it had raised Banco Santander-Chile's local currency long-term counterparty rating rating to A from BBB, and its foreign currency long-term counterparty rating and long-term CD rating to A minus from BBB.
"Standard & Poor's has removed these ratings from CreditWatch, where they were placed April 11, 1996," the agency said in a statement.
At the same time, S&P assigned its A1 local currency short-term rating and A2 foreign currency short-term rating to the bank.
S&P said the outlook for all the ratings was stable.
